Gene.FullName: PMS1 homolog 2, mismatch repair system component

RCVAccession.Title: NM_000535.7(PMS2):c.1264del (p.Glu422fs) AND Hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal neoplasms

GermlineClassification.ReviewStatus: criteria provided, multiple submitters, no conflicts

Classification.Comment: For these reasons, this variant has been classified as Pathogenic. This variant has not been reported in the literature in individuals affected with PMS2-related conditions. This variant is not present in population databases (gnomAD no frequency). This sequence change creates a premature translational stop signal (p.Glu422Argfs*26) in the PMS2 gene. It is expected to result in an absent or disrupted protein product. Loss-of-function variants in PMS2 are known to be pathogenic (PMID: 21376568, 24362816).

The c.1264delG pathogenic mutation, located in coding exon 11 of the PMS2 gene, results from a deletion of one nucleotide at nucleotide position 1264, causing a translational frameshift with a predicted alternate stop codon (p.E422Rfs*26). This variant is considered to be rare based on population cohorts in the Genome Aggregation Database (gnomAD). This alteration is expected to result in loss of function by premature protein truncation or nonsense-mediated mRNA decay. As such, this alteration is interpreted as a disease-causing mutation.
